info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 18 at 2:59PM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Colorado...Utah... Colorado River near CO-UT State Line affecting Mesa and Grand Counties. .The combination of warm, spring temperatures, potential for periods of rain falling on snowpack, and controlled reservoir releases upstream will continue to increase runoff. High water levels and strong flow in the Colorado River will continue through the weekend. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by rain, snowmelt, and reservoir releases continues. * WHERE...Colorado River near CO-UT State Line. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...at 10.0 ft, minor flooding is expected between Redlands and Loma, and sections of the Riverfront Pedestrian/Bike Trail become inundated with water. Impacts...at 12.00 ft, low-land flooding is likely between the Redlands and Loma. Water levels approach bridge structures along I-70, between Fruita and Loma. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 12.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 13.7 feet late Tuesday morning. - Action stage is 12.5 feet. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Colorado River CO-UT State Lin 15.0 12.9 Thu 1 pm MDT 13.3 13.4 13.5 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks, and please heed all trail and roadway closures. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
